current-chamber.#text: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

official-title.#text:
To establish scientific standards and protocols across forensic disciplines, and for other
			 purposes.

sponsor.#tail: introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the

committee-name.#text: Committee on Commerce, Science, and Transportation

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Forensic Science and Standards Act of 2014

short-title.#text: Forensic Science and Standards Act of 2014

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the
The table of contents of this Act is as follows:

toc-entry.#text: Sec. 1. Short title; table of contents.
Sec. 4. National forensic science research program.
Sec. 5. Forensic science research grants program.
Sec. 10. National Institute of Standards and Technology functions.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, the National Academy of Sciences led a comprehensive review
			 of the
			 state of forensic science and issued its findings in a 2009 report,

text.#text:
at the direction
			 of

quote.#text:
Strengthening Forensic Science in the United States: A Path
			 Forward

text.#text:
the report's
			 findings indicate the need for independent scientific research to support
			 the
			 foundation of forensic disciplines;

the report
			 stresses the need for standards in methods, data interpretation, and
			 reporting,
			 and the importance of preventing cognitive bias and mitigating human
			 factors;
			 and

according to the report, forensic science
			 research is not financially well supported, and there is a need for a
			 unified
			 strategy for developing a forensic science research plan across Federal
			 agencies.

means the basic
			 and applied scientific research applicable to the collection, evaluation,

			 analysis of physical evidence, including digital evidence, for use in

text.#text: The term

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Forensic Science and Standards Act of 2014/s:3/p:3/sp:A

term.#tail:
means a systematic study to gain knowledge or
			 understanding necessary to determine the means by which a recognized and
			 specific need may be met.

text.#text: In

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Forensic Science and Standards Act of 2014/s:3/p:3/sp:A

term.#tail:
means a systematic study directed toward fuller
			 knowledge or understanding of the fundamental aspects of phenomena and of
			 observable facts without specific applications towards processes or
			 products.

text.#text: In

term.#tail:
means a domestic or an international organization that
			 plans, develops, establishes, or coordinates voluntary consensus standards
			 using procedures that incorporate openness, a balance of interests,
			 consensus,
			 due process, and an appeals process.

There

			 and
			 coordinate Federal research in the forensic sciences.

text.#text:
The purpose of a prize or challenge under
			 this section, among other possible purposes, may be—

to determine or develop the best data
			 collection practices or analytical methods to evaluate a specific type of
			 forensic data; or

to determine the
			 accuracy of an analytical method.

A Federal department, agency, or office, or multiple
			 Federal departments, agencies, or offices in cooperation, carrying out a
			 prize
			 or challenge under this section—

may establish a
			 prize advisory board; and

shall select each
			 member of the prize advisory board with input from relevant Federal
			 departments, agencies, or offices.
The prize advisory board shall—

identify 1 or
			 more types of forensic evidence for purposes of a prize or challenge;

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, recommend how to structure a prize or challenge that
			 requires a competitor to develop a forensic data collection practice, an
			 analytical method, or a relevant approach or technology to be tested
			 relative
			 to a known outcome or other proposed judging methodology; and
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Forensic Science and Standards Act of 2014/s:6/ss:b/p:3

using the samples
			 under
